item.title: Irreducibility of the Cuboid Polynomial $P_{a,u}(t)$ via a Rank-Zero Elliptic Curve
item.description:
arXiv:2510.11768v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For coprime integers $a
eq u>0$ put $\Delta:=u^2-a^2
eq0$ and $A_0:=a^2u^2$. Consider \[ P_{a,u}(t)=t^8+6\Delta\,t^6+(\Delta^2-2A_0)\,t^4-6\Delta A_0\,t^2+A_0^2\in\mathbb{Z}[t]. \] We prove $P_{a,u}(t)$ is irreducible over $\mathbb{Z}$. The argument is: (1) over $K=\mathbb{Q}(\sqrt2)$, $P_{a,u}$ splits as $H_-H_+$ with coprime conjugate quartics $H_\pm$; (2) any hypothetical $K$--factorization of $H_\pm$ forces a rational point on a fixed genus--one quartic $\mathcal{C}: v^2=16y^4+136y^2+1$ with the structural constraint $	au=y^2=(au/\Delta)^2$; (3) the Jacobian of $\mathcal{C}$ admits a Weierstrass model $E/\mathbb{Q}$ on which a Magma computation certifies $\mathrm{rank}\,E(\mathbb{Q})=0$ and $E(\mathbb{Q})_{\mathrm{tors}}\cong \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\oplus\mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z}$; (4) the only rational $	au$ arising from $\mathcal{C}(\mathbb{Q})$ are $	au\in\{0,1/4\}$, incompatible with coprime integers $a
eq u>0$. Therefore $H_\pm$ are irreducible in $K[t]$, whence $P_{a,u}$ is irreducible in $\mathbb{Q}[t]$ and in $\mathbb{Z}[t]$ by Gauss.
